articles.author: Zahra, Product manager, PMS team
articles.description:
Improvement
Â Â 
Good news! After releasing the new calendar interface, many of you reacted, we thank you for that, and we heard your feedbacks ! 
We did some evolutions to adapt the calendar new interface and make it match your needs. 
What are the main evolutions?
1- More listings displayed
In the first version of new calendar interface the planning was limited to 25 properties, now it goes up to 100 properties.
2- The filters
Few hours after the release we enabled all the 8 filters !
3- The logos more visible
The logos of the sources are now colored in white, it makes them more visible 
Small tipðŸ’¡
Some of you need to visualize more properties on the planning view.
If you zoom out your calendar page you can make the lines thinner and be able to see more properties.

We invite you to discover all these evolutions, and hope it will help you to have a better management of your calendar, save more time, and make more bookings !
Wishing you all a pleasant day!
articles.title: Evolution - New Calendar Interface

articles.author: Audrey, Partnerships Development
articles.description:
Partners
Â Â 
As you may know, we were pleased to participate in the Vacation Rental World Summit in Porto last week as a Gold Sponsor !
This was the 6th edition of this event, which is becoming increasingly popular each year.
It provides an opportunity for us to meet our partners and customers. We are also always happy and curious to get to know new players in our amazing industry.
These shared moments exchanging with lots of different actors allow us to stay informed about trends and activity in the vacation rental industry.

This year again, this event dedicated to vacation rentals has boosted our collaboration with, among others, our official partners!
At Smily, the quality of our partnerships matters a lot. We want to offer our customers the smoothest integrations and the best assistance we can, from us and from our partners.
We thank our partners who were present at VRWS a lot for the quality of our discussions and their enthusiasm towards our collaboration! :)
Airbnb - Channel


Beyond - Pricing tool


Booking.com- Channel


Breezeway - Tasks manager


Chekin - Check-ins automation


ENSO connect - Guest communication


Duve - Guest experience


Holidu - Channel


Hometogo - Channel


Igloohome - Smartlocks


Keydata - Data provider


Nuki- Smartlocks


PriceLabs - Pricing tool


Superhog - Check-ins automation


Swikly - Deposit management


TouchStay - Welcome Book


Transparent - Data provider


VRBO - Channel


Yaago - Guest experience


Don't hesitate to contact our support team if you would like more information about any of these partners. We would love you to benefit from the great things we have to come with all of them :)
articles.title: Smily was in Porto at VRWS ! :)

articles.author: Zahra, Product manager, PMS team
articles.description:
New!
Â Â 
Good News!
At Smily, we are here to help you to Save time and Book more. That's why we are always thrilled to announce more and more features.
This time the new feature concerns your calendar. After many years of loyal service and in response to many requests, we have overhauled the calendar interface, for aesthetic reasons, of course, but above all to make it more efficient and more intuitive for you.
What are the main changes?
First of all, we are aware that the calendar is your main tool for managing your bookings. So, to ensure a smooth transition, for the moment we have maintained the old calendar view, so that you can switch easily from one to another.
1- Two different views: Planning and Month
We separated the planning and the month views into 2 different sections to have a â€¦
articles.title: New Calendar interface!

articles.description:
Incident began at 2022-09-16 17:23 and ended at 2022-09-17 00:27 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

Full Incident Report

SUMMARY:

On Friday, 16 September at 10:23 US/Pacific, Cloud Support Systems, which utilizes a 3rd party product, experienced row-lock errors while updating cases. This preventedSupport agents from being able to update or make changes to some Support cases. Additionally, the send email to customers action was unavailable for some Support cases. Some customers may have seen an error when updating cases from the customer portal. As a workaround, customers and Support agents could successfully update their cases by retrying the action. The issue was mitigated at 17:27 US/Pacific and service was fully restored for both the Support agents and customers. The total duration of the service disruption was 7 hours and 4 minutes.

ROOT CAUSE:

Cloud Support Systems experienced a large backlog of case field update actions pending in the SLO timed actions queue. These timed actions were running in large batches, with updates running in the queue every few minutes. This caused the cases to be locked down from any other update actions while that job was running.

This backlog was caused by the following:

  • There was an increase in the limit of cases being processed every hour by the SLO time queue job.
  • There was a rollback issue with the 3rd party product while processing time based tasks which caused multiple processing requests of the same tasks.
  • There was a configuration in the case trigger which created a backlog on large batches which triggered the above bug with the 3rd party product.

REMEDIATION AND PREVENTION:

Our engineers were alerted to the issue by an internal support agent's case on Monday, 12 September 2022. Engineering began investigating and working on a solution. On Tuesday, September 13 there was one report of external impact. The issue progressed and impact became visible externally on Friday, 16 September 2022 at 10:23 US/Pacific, and the row lock issue was confirmed to have widespread external impact. Once the nature and scope of the issue became clear, Google engineers filed a case with the 3rd party product support to address the issue with Cloud Systems. The backlog actions were purged manually using the 3rd party setup UI which brought the backlog in the queue down by 80%, the issue was completely resolved for the end user on Friday, 16 September at 17:27 US/Pacific.

Google is committed to preventing recurrence by implementing the following action items:

  • Implement a code enhancement with the 3rd party vendor to confirm the error handling code which triggered the issue is fixed.

Affected products: Google Workspace Support
articles.title: RESOLVED: We're experiencing an issue affecting less than an estimated 30% of the Google Workspace Support user base. We will provide an update by Sep 16, 2022, 8:00 PM UTC detailing when we expect to resolve the problem. Please note that this resolution time is an estimate and may change. The affected users are able to access Google Workspace Support, but are seeing error messages, high latency, and/or other unexpected behavior.

articles.description:
Issue summary:

From 12:46 PDT on October 3, 2022 until 7:42 PDT on October 6, 2022, customers on the Free and Pro plans using a confirmation code to log in, saw an invalid code error when entering the code they received by email.


The issue was traced to a recent update. Reverting this update fixed the issue for all affected customer.
articles.title: Incident: Issues with login confirmation codes

articles.description:
Issue summary:


Starting September 21st around 1:00 PM PDT until September 28th 3:00 PM PDT, users experienced trouble downloading files on Slack's Android app version: 22.09.30. We traced the problem to a permissions check error which caused file downloads to not execute.


We corrected the permissions check error in the latest version of the Android app: 22.09.40, and the file download functionality was restored. Some impacted users may need to update their Slack app to version 22.09.40 from the Google Play Store.
articles.title: Incident: Issues downloading files on Slack Android app version 22.09.30

articles.description:
Issue summary:

From September 26, 2022 at 7:00 AM PDT until September 27, 2022 at 12:40 PM PDT, some Enterprise Grid users were not able to create new webhooks, share posts to a channel, or select a channel from the dropdown menu in Workflow Builder. We traced this problem to a change that was made to improve how channel objects are loaded into Slack. We disabled this change, restoring functionality to impacted users.
articles.title: Incident: Some Enterprise Grid users are unable to retrieve channel lists when building workflows and webhooks

articles.description:
Issue summary:


On September 26, 2022 from 12:00 PM PDT to 11:48 PM PDT, link formatting was broken for all Slack apps.


Some messages were showing the URL and not a link itself. We determined that this issue was caused by a recent code change that altered how attachment links in the app were formatted.


We reverted this change which fixed the issue for all users after a force reload of Slack.
articles.title: Incident: Issues with legacy message attachments

articles.description: We have rolled out a fix and notifications via Salesforce for Slack app should be now working as expected. We appreciate your patience.
articles.title: Incident: Some customers may not be receiving notifications via the Salesforce for Slack app.

articles.description:
Issue summary:


Starting September 6th, 2022, we identified an issue with the Google Sheet app inside Workflow Builder. This issue caused the app to read the spreadsheet date/time format wrong, inserting the incorrect time value in the timestamp.


We discovered this was due to the app processing the workflow step with a single digit value instead of a double digit value.


Users can continue highlighting the Submission Time column in the spreadsheet and select Format â†’ Number â†’ Custom Number Format and insert: ddd mmm yyyy hh:mm:ss, as a workaround.


We will work to fix this through a bug ticket that has been filed as a result of this incident. Though we have not resolved this issue yet, we will provide further updates through customer support tickets with the impacted users.
articles.title: Incident: Spreadsheet data added using workflows may be incorrect

articles.description: Thank you for your patience while we were working on this. For now, we will track this internally as a bug while we continue to find resolution. If youâ€™re still experiencing this behaviour, please reach out to us atÂ feedback@slack.com.
articles.title: Incident: Some users might have trouble with posts

articles.description:
Issue summary:


On September 13, 2022 from 10:33 AM PDT to 3:21 PM PDT, some customers were unable to see group direct messages in their sidebars due to a recent update. Reverting the update fixed the issue for all affected customers.
articles.title: Incident: Direct Messages with three or more people are missing from the Direct Message list for all workspaces

We are working on a fix ASAP. You might need to reauthorize your Facebook connection then.
Affected apps: Facebook, Facebook Ads Campaign Management, Facebook Catalogs, Facebook Conversions API, Facebook Custom Audiences, Facebook Groups, Facebook Insights, Facebook Lead Ads, Facebook Offline Conversions, Facebook Pages, Instagram for Business.
